fields.description:
Currently, to hide fields in the issue layout users would need to drag and drop fields to the hidden fields section one at a time.

Users would like the option to select multiple fields and then drag and drop the fields to the hidden fields section in one go.
fields.summary: Ability to select multiple fields then drag and drop in the hidden fields section in issue layout

fields.description:
Users that don't have access to the product for example Jira Software can be seen and selected from the project's people page, users that don't have access to the project should not appear on the list.
 !image-2020-10-12-15-05-26-627.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-10-12-15-06-11-821.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: If a user don't have access to Jira Software, that user should not appear in the people page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

Automation rule configured to assign to users within a project role in a round robin style, fails when attempting to automatically assign to a former user who still appears in a project role table.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create automation rule to assign issue to a project role that contains a removed user
 # Run Automation rule until it assigns the issue to a user who was in a project role who has been removed and observe the rule will fail.

h3. Expected Results

That any removed users are not included in the user picker for project role, thus preventing the rule from failing.
h3. Actual Results

Rule Fails with error message that the issue could not be assigned to the removed user in the Automation For Jira audit log.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Assigning to removed user (based on project role) in Automation For Jira leads to failure of Automation Rule

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the issue type field is not part of Edit Issue screen in _Project Settings > Screens_ or if the issue type field isn't in the configuration screen for the new issue view, when we hover over the issue type icon in issue view, the name of the issue type is not shown.

Or, if you do not have permission to edit the issue, be it trough the permission scheme or by using an workflow property such as *jira.permission.edit.group*, or even if you do not have the *Move* permission when there are different workflows, a warning will be displayed instead of showing the name of the issue type.

See the recording: [^Issue type warning.mp4]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Confirm that issue type is not present in Edit Issue Screen that is applied to the project
 # Access any issue of the project and try to hover over the icon of the issue type

h3. Expected Results

The name of the issue type should be shown: 

!image-2021-03-25-14-11-40-290.png|width=236,height=127!
h3. Actual Results

The name of the issue is not shown. The information is only shown if we add issue type in the Edit Issue Screen:

[https://share.getcloudapp.com/v1ubKgy4]
h3. Workaround

Add issue type field to the Edit Issue screen in Project Settings > Screens

Also, you can still check the name of the issue type by hovering over it on the issue search navigation, or in the results of gadgets:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-19 at 10.33.33 (2).png|thumbnail!
h3. Additional workaround: keeping a reference of the issue type's name in the issue view
 * Create a text custom field that will contain the name of the issue type:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-22 at 15.06.24.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2021-04-22 at 15.06.32.png|thumbnail!
 * Add it to the screens in your project;
 ** You can, for example use different screens for the issue edition and view operations;
 ** Then, add that field to the screen used by the view operation, but not the edit one;
 ** That will prevent the field from being edited by users. See [Manage screen schemes|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/manage-screen-schemes/#Associating-a-screen-with-an-issue-operation];
 * Export the issues you need to CSV (current fields) with the fields: Key, Summary, and Issue type:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-22 at 15.07.46.png|thumbnail!
 * Edit the CSV file so only the columns Key, Summary (leave this one empty), and Issue type are present:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-22 at 15.08.06.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2021-04-22 at 15.08.17.png|thumbnail!
 * Import the CSV file (*https://<YOUR_SITE>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ExternalImport1.jspa*), and map the fields so the column issue type will point to the new field:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-22 at 15.09.40.png|thumbnail!
 ** That will populate the new field with the current name of the issue types on each respective issue:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-22 at 15.10.23.png|thumbnail!

For future issues:
 * Create an Automation rule that will get the name of the issue type, and put it on the custom field you had created:
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-22 at 15.16.12.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2021-04-22 at 15.16.18.png|thumbnail!

Other hints:
 * If you want to highlight the issue type name in the issue view, you can use the button to pin the field to the top:
 !pin field1.png|thumbnail! !pin field2.png|thumbnail!
 * Also, for other actions such as when the issue type changes, you can create other automation rules to modify the custom field when that happens.
fields.summary: Not possible to see the issue type name if you cannot edit the issue type of the issue due to a specific context

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If an exported issue contains a comment linking to an issue present in the CSV file, convert the link of the old issue to the imported issue's URL
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export a CSV file which contains comments with links to issues in the file
 # Import the CSV file and map Comments to Comment Body

h3. Expected Results

It would be good if the comment on the imported issue was reflecting the new issue URL (imported one) rather than the old issue link
h3. Workaround

No workaround available apart from editing the comments manually
fields.summary: Convert the old issue link to the imported issue link in the comments field when using CSV import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using order by priority clause in a JQL or sorting the results by priority groups the issues by project type before actually sorting the results. So all issues from classic projects are grouped and sorted before any issue from Team managed projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an advanced search with at least one Company managed and one Team managed project
 # Add an order by priority clause to the query and run it

h3. Expected Results

The issue list should be sorted by priority independently from the project type.
h3. Actual Results

The issue list is being grouped by project type before being sorted, thus making the classic project issues appear before any next-gen project issues.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: JQL searches that Sort by priority segregates results from team managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Required Field not placed on any screen still prevents an issue to be created.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Associate a field configuration to a project.
 # Put any field of the associated field configuration as required.
 # Do not place this field on the screen associated to an issue type
 # Try to create an issue.

h3. Expected Results

Issue created successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Even without being shown on the screen, an error message is shown  saying that the field is required:

!image-2021-03-24-17-55-33-221.png!
h3. Workaround

Associate the issue type to a field configuration that do not have this field as required.
fields.summary: Required Field not placed on any screen is preventing an issue to be created

fields.description:
The divider provided in the editor for the new issue view is not very well visible in the issue view as the white background may impair its visibility.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Enhance contrast of divider in the new issue editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Fields like *Affected Services* may have a different database value from the one appearing on the UI. This misleads the users to add the incorrect value to be compared in the Value Field Condition, which causes the condition to fail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a service for your ITSM project by giving it a simple name (e.g., Database)
 # Edit a workflow of this ITSM project
 # Add a Value Field Condition:
 ** *Condition:* "="
 ** *Value:* Database
 ** *Comparison Type:* String
 # Publish the updated workflow
 # Create a ticket with the *Affected Services* field value to *Database*
 # Open the transitions

h3. Expected Results

The transition with the condition should be available to be used.
h3. Actual Results

The transition with the condition isn't available.

This is due to the field *Affected Services* stores a different value from the one that appears in the UI.
h3. Workaround

You can discover the database value of the *Affected Services* by opening a ticket via REST API in your browser with:
{noformat}
https://<yourinstancename>/.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/<issuekey>?expand=names{noformat}
!Screenshot_03-24 13.47.03_q2GxOm.png!

Search for *Affected Services*, get the customfield_XXXXX value and use it to a new search, with this, you should be able to find the database value of the *Affected Services* for the ticket you used:

!Screenshot_03-24 13.46.55_GdJxgp.png!

!Screenshot_03-24 13.47.18_oYexsI.png!

On your Value Field Condition, set the *Value* to the one that you found using the above method.
 !Screenshot_03-24 13.53.10_L0xJv9.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Value Field Condition doesn't show the transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When pasting certain URLs in a comment, the actual hyperlink is truncated even if the text shows correctly.

This was identified on URLs that were modified by a software (ProofPoint) for inbound email security. The modified URL is correctly displayed on the ticket, however its hyperlink is truncated and unaccessible. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Copy the link (Right click -> Copy, not Copy Link Text) and paste into a comment. Then click the hyperlink > Edit. Note that the text is correct while the hyperlink URL is truncated.

OR

Copy and paste as text, click on the link or leave your mouse over it.

h3. Expected Results

The hyperlink shouldn't be truncated and should be accessible, as the comment URL is.

h3. Actual Results

The URL hyperlink is truncated and may result in an invalid link.

h3. Workaround

- You can select and copy the comment URL and manually paste it on our browser.
- The hyperlink can be viewed and edited manually by clicking on the link while the editor is open and selecting the "Edit link" option. On Chrome, a potential workaround is to copy the link via right click > "Copy Link Address", then pasting it into the editor.
fields.summary: Comment URL truncated on hyperlinks in new issue view

fields.description:
Currently the main panel in the issue view is too small and you cannot resize it.  I also can't hide anything on the left panel, like I can with Confluence.

Due to the small amount of space - code snippets get cut-off and also the font seemed to change size to be larger.

Ideally I could move the scrollbar on the main panel on the right of issues to resize them.

 

Given that you are forcing all users to update on 3/31 - I'd request that this would be looked at quickly - since I'm sure I'm not alone
fields.summary: New Issue View - Ability to resize panels in issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"Product Discovery" option which is unclickable is shown on view all projects page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go view all projects page (https://XXX.atlassian.net/projects)
 # See the options for selecting types
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-24 at 9.57.17.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
"Product Discovery" option is not shown

h3. Actual Results
"Product Discovery" option is shown

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Product Discovery" option is shown on view all projects page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Labels dropdown (which shows recent/existing labels) does not load on the new issue view when navigating from one issue to another.

h3. Environment
Jira New Issue View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a queue and open up an existing issue. Add a label to the issue.
# Return back to the queue by clicking on the queue on the sidebar and click on a different issue.
# Try adding a label on the issue.

h3. Expected Results

A dropdown with existing and recent labels should show.

h3. Actual Results

The dropdown shows 'No matches'

h3. Workaround

Refresh the issue page and the labels dropdown should load again.

 !Screen Shot 2021-03-24 at 12.10.38.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Labels dropdown does not load when navigation from one issue to another

fields.description:
It would be useful to have an option to set colours for custom issue type icons instead of using an image file. 

For example, if I want a custom issue to use solid blue for its icon I have to upload a file. This results in card colours not matching the custom issue colour.

I have to go to the board settings > card colours and manually change the colour Jira set by default by providing RGB values in order to match card colours with their respective custom issue colour.
fields.summary: Allow the option to choose a set colour for custom issue type icons

fields.description:
Users would benefit from the ability to perform filter actions on the backlog issues of a board, for example, exporting them, ordering them by a specific field or any other actions available for JQL results.

This can be achieved by adding this options in the backlog section of a board or by providing users with a means to translate the backlog to a JQL search in which the above mentioned actions can be performed.
fields.summary: Ability to perform additional actions on backlog or obtain the JQL query to get the backlog issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a project has one or more [archived versions|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/manage-versions/], and any user attempts to edit that issue in order to either add or remove said archived version, the user will not see any sort of error or failure to indicate that this is not something they can do via REST API update.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a project create two issues, example issue keys ABC-1 and ABC-2
 # Create a version in that project called 'example'
 # Add 'example' version to the FixVersion field of ABC-1
 # Archive the 'example' version (Project settings > versions > ... Archive
 # using the REST API, attempt to add 'example' to the FixVersion field of ABC-2
 # using the REST API, attempt to remove 'example' from the FixVersion field of ABC-1

h3. Expected Results

For steps 5 and 6: We would expect that if this issue edit is somehow unsuccessful, that Jira would provide some kind of indication of this in the REST API response here. Such as a HTTP 400 error with an error message that indicates something along the lines of a bad-request, or perhaps something more targeted to indicate that the version cannot be modified
h3. Actual Results

REST API call provides an HTTP 204 response. In turn the end user/script has no idea that their edit did not actual go through as planned.

End user has no indication that this particular version is archived.

If an end user in the web UI attempts to make this change, they can at least see that a version is archived and not-removable from an existing issue where it is applied.

!versionisarchived1.png|width=576,height=252!
h3. Workaround

A project administrator (or system admin) must first unarchive that version. Once this is done any user with permissions to edit that issue can then make changes via REST APi successfully.
fields.summary: Attempting to add or remove an archived version on an issue using the REST API does not indicate any failure

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the browser version on iOS devices (iPhone/iPads) it's not possible to select a different issue type on the sub-task creation screen. The dropdown forces to use the same issue type in order to function.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Jira project, have more than one sub-task issue type, containing a required field;
 # Create a task;
 # Create a sub-task selecting its issue type;
 # On the sub-task creation screen try to select a different issue type.

h3. Expected Results
It's possible to select the issue type normally.

h3. Actual Results
Not possible to select the issue type in the dropdown.

h3. Workaround
You can select the issue type before opening the create sub-task screen.
fields.summary: Not possible to select the issue type when creating sub-tasks through the screen using the native iOS app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Cloning an issue that has a strikethrough text with a dash on the description field, the strikethrough text is missed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue
 # Add a text containing a dash with a strikethrough on the description field:
-testing - bug-
 # Clone the issue

h3. Expected Results
The cloned issue should display the text with the strikethrough correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The strikethrough is missed on the description field.

Reproducing the problem: [^strikethroughDescriptBug.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Cloning an issue that has a strikethrough text with a dash on the description fails

fields.description:
h3. Description
At this time New Issue View does not display the transition name in case the user has only one transition available to perform.
 !image-2021-03-23-14-05-13-020.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Use case
The user has two transitions, but one of them has a condition that only users in a specific role are able to perform. In that case, instead of seeing the "Transition + Status name" the users are only going to see the "Status" name.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Display transition name in case the transition and status name are not the same. It would be nice to have this information so the users can have a better understanding of what that transition means like "Canceling" a ticket or set as "Resolved".
fields.summary: Display workflow transition name in case it's different from Status name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Even disabling the cascading field second option it will continue to appear in the view screen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Cascading custom field
 # Add first option e.g.: Option 1
 # Then, add the second field option. e.g.: Option 2
 # Disable the option 2
 # [Video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/2NuwYwgg] with this configuration and behaviour.

h3. Expected Results
The second option should not appear under the view screen. 

h3. Actual Results
It will continues appearing. 

h3. Workaround
If possible, we can delete the option instead of disable.
fields.summary: Even disabling the cascading field second option it will continue to appear in the view screen

fields.description: Currently, only fields can have descriptions to provide instructions on how to fill them, it would be helpful if tabs could also have a description to provide more instructions on the data needed.
fields.summary: Ability to add Tab descriptions

fields.description:
Currently, creating an issue (story or task) and attributing an Original Estimate to it is rather pointless for teams that use sub-tasks for the parent issues and log time against those sub-tasks. 

The time logged will feed correctly into the parent issue, but will not affect the time remaining on the parent issue.

Presumably this is due to Jira only subtracting from the Original Estimate _if_ work is logged directly on the issue at hand.
fields.summary: Make it possible for work logged on subtasks to affect the time remaining on the parent issue

fields.description:
When creating "Back up for cloud" or "Back up for server" in JIRA cloud site, the backup is not starting. The page itself got reloaded and no other result. I have tried the same with multiple cloud organization account in multiple browser.

While clicking "Backup manager" option from "System" setting window, "Sources" tab in development tool throws exception 

Below are some of error and warning trace found in console

Default levelsVM1919 CloudExport.jspa:904 GET https://************.atlassian.net/s/sb53l8/b/24/91e2710…/_/jira-logo-scaled.png 404batch.js?feature-jir…ue&locale=en-GB:291

DEPRECATED JS - Cookie has been deprecated since 5.8.0 and will be removed in a future release. Use cookie instead. at b.default ([https://d9x1z07c483jl.cloudfront.net/atl-vertigo--shard-jira-prod-ap-10--4-…batch.js?feature-jira-classic-jquery-vuln-217984=true&locale=en-GB:288:209|https://d9x1z07c483jl.cloudfront.net/atl-vertigo--shard-jira-prod-ap-10--4-%E2%80%A6batch.js?feature-jira-classic-jquery-vuln-217984=true&locale=en-GB:288:209])

DevTools failed to load SourceMap: Could not load content for [https://d9x1z07c483jl.cloudfront.net/atl-vertigo--shard-jira-prod-ap-10--4-…92701c54e1b655cce/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/LegacyIssue-min.js.map|https://d9x1z07c483jl.cloudfront.net/atl-vertigo--shard-jira-prod-ap-10--4-%E2%80%A692701c54e1b655cce/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/LegacyIssue-min.js.map]: HTTP error: status code 404, net::ERR_HTTP_RESPONSE_CODE_FAILURE

DevTools failed to load SourceMap: Could not load content for [https://d9x1z07c483jl.cloudfront.net/atl-vertigo--shard-jira-prod-ap-10--4-…global,jira.admin,atl.global,-_super/issueParentMultiselectUtil-min.js.map|https://d9x1z07c483jl.cloudfront.net/atl-vertigo--shard-jira-prod-ap-10--4-%E2%80%A6global,jira.admin,atl.global,-_super/issueParentMultiselectUtil-min.js.map]: HTTP error: status code 404, net::ERR_HTTP_RESPONSE_CODE_FAILURE
fields.summary: Backup manager not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Reported Issues" button for Reporter does not work in Google Chrome and Edge

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any Jira issue 
# Hover over the Reporter
# Click on the "Reported issues" button

h3. Expected Results
A new chrome window opens that filters out the issues opened by the Reporter

h3. Actual Results
The ew window is not loaded and you only get an option to change the reporter of the issue.
The below exception is thrown in the console log of developer tools:
{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Failed to execute 'open' on 'Window': required member conversionDestination is undefined.
    at Object.onClick [as current]
{noformat}
 


h3.Workaround
Use Mozilla firefox,
fields.summary: "Reported Issues" button for Reporter does not work in Google chrome and Edge

fields.description:
{panel:title=Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

When trying to configure the Slack integration, the admin can see the following error message due to the lack of project permissions to "*atlassian-addons-project-access*":
{code:none}
Slack error: something went wrong while getting project connection list
{code}
!image-20201029-041002.png!
h3. Suggested Solution

Clarify how to fix the project permission where a self-service fix is available.
h3. Workaround

The cause of the error can vary:

*Case #1*: Open the project permission and check whether the project role "*atlassian-addons-project-access*" is granted all of the permissions. If not, here's how to fix the permission configs:
 * Log in as a Jira admin
 * go to [Settings] → *Issues → Permission schemes*
 * Find *Default Permission Scheme* and click *Permissions* to edit it
 * On the next page, click *Grant permission*, select *all* the permissions and grant them to "*atlassian-addons-project-access*"
 * Repeat the process to all the ** permission schemes where you need to integrate the apps

If you only see the error on a specific project, it's more likely to fall into this case.

!image-20201029-042032.png!

*Case #2*: If the site in question experienced any of the following operations recently, reach out to [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] so that Atlassian Support can reinstall the Slack app:
 * renamed site subdomain
 * migrated from Server to Cloud
 * had a backup restored

*Others*:
 * Exceeding Slack's [rate limit|https://api.slack.com/docs/rate-limits]
 * Connecting to the shared channel - refer to JRACLOUD-68798 for more details

Besides, consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Improve missing permission error of the Slack integration

fields.description:
The right side panel under the new issue view sometimes contain a large number of fields (as per configured layout and per business requirement.

It will be a good thing to have an option to collapse the right panel from view when required to have a cleaner visibility when viewing the issue.

Similar to the left side panel. See screenshot below:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add option to collapse the right panel of the new issue view

fields.description:
Currently, removing a group from a project role on the *People* section of the project does not register what was the project role. It would be awesome to know which project role the group was removed.

Use case: Sometimes, we manage permissions using project roles and granting a role to a group, so if we remove the group from that project role, we cannot see what was the role and it might cause some permission issues.
fields.summary: Removing a group from a project role does not register the project role

fields.description: After writing or editing a comment, a keyboard shortcut to add or save the comment would be helpful to make commenting easier.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut to save a comment

fields.description:
Jira Dashboard filter results gadget shoul have the option to lock its height for better orientation.

When having e.g. 6 filter results in a gadget, that is set to show 10 results, the table adapts to 6. For better view might be nicer when the tables' sizes don't change every day.

A checkbox to make Number of results as a constant height would be most welcome.
fields.summary: Filter Results Gadget constant height

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When typing the key of an issue and then pressing the space bar or enter, a smart link will be generated with the link to that issue and its current status.

Currently, you are unable to copy those values from the new view to other sources by using *ctrl + c* (cmd + c in MAC), or right clicking -> copy.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Add a smart link in an issue using the new view;
 * Click on the field again to enter edit mode.
 * Try to copy that value.

h3. Expected Results

The value is copied and you can paste it in other sources.
h3. Actual Results

The value is not copied. Pasting on other sources will create spaces instead.

See the recording: [^Copy smart-link behaviour.mp4]
h3. Workaround



You can copy the content from the issue search navigation results (see the previous recording).
Or, Click the Edit link option on the smartlink and copy the value inside.

Or, copy the value without entering edit mode: [^Copy smart-link view mode.mp4]
fields.summary: Unable to copy smart link from the new view to other sources while in editing mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Previously in the old view the suggestions displayed when clicking in the field *Sprint* displayed the sprints that you last interacted with first. 

Now, with the new view, that's not true. 

See the recording showing the comparison of results:  [^Sprint sugestions - Old vs New.mp4] 

h3. Suggestion

The Sprint field does not restrict the results per project (issues can be added to any sprint of each project). The suggestions displayed in the old view are helpful to reduce the incidence of adding issues to wrong sprints. For example, if a user works only on a project, the suggestions will point to sprints from that project only.

The suggestion is to have the new view display the suggestions just like the old view did: by order of interaction.
fields.summary: Sprint suggestions in new view should follow users' work history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing attachment of type "text", the first three lines get hidden behind the preview header. This does not help as we are unable to view all the information,
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a attachment of type .txt on an issue
 # Open the attachment

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to see all the text lines clearly
h3. Actual Results

The first three lines get overridden by the preview header that displays the attachment name. This is applicable for any text files including code (py, sql, js, java, json, ect...)
 !Image 2021-03-22 at 10.00.17 PM.jpg|width=355,height=208!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When viewing attachment of type "text", the first three lines get hidden behind the preview header

fields.description: Jira Cloud Connector for Microsoft teams is supporting just issue created/issue updated notification events, it would be helpful to also support mentions/tags in issue comments.
fields.summary: Support mentions in MS Teams integration

fields.description:
h3. Summary

You can add fields to the *Description fields* area in the Issue layout settings. Those fields will then be displayed in the center of the screen.

But, currently, not all fields follow the same pattern when added to that area. 

For example: 
* Multi-line text fields display the name of the field on the top, while its value goes under the field's name;
* Other fields, such as checkboxes and select lists, are disposed with their names on the left wile their values are displayed to the right.

See the screenshots below:
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-22 at 10.27.36.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-03-22 at 10.27.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

That might become hard to read depending on the number of fields. 

A suggestion is to have all fields be standardized when added to that section. That is, all fields should display information in the same way.
fields.summary: Standardize fields under the Description fields area in Issue layout

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Activity Stream gadget shows all images in the original image size from the New issue view. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an image in the new issue view in the comment or Description.
 # The image will be shown in full image resolution in the Activity Stream.

h3. Expected Results

A resized image or a thumbnail of the image should be shown in the Activity Stream
h3. Actual Results

The image is shown in full resolution.
h3. Workaround

No available workaround.
fields.summary: Change the Activity Stream gadget to show all images as thumbnails instead of the original image size

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Sprint field is one of the options to be edited during a bulk edit operation. You need to enter the ID of the desired sprint that you want to apply to the issues being edited in the operation.

According to our documentation [Edit multiple issues at the same time|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/edit-multiple-issues-at-the-same-time]:
{quote}
This operation only affects active and future sprints, i.e. closed/completed sprints are not included when bulk editing the Sprint field.
{quote}

The documentation gives the idea that only active and future sprints should be affected when editing the field (be overwritten).

But currently if you bulk-edit the field Sprint in multiple issues all the sprints (even completed ones) are overwritten by the sprint whose ID you set during the operation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Perform an advanced search of issues that are part of completed sprints;
* Bulk-edit their Sprint field setting the ID of a new sprint.

h3. Expected Results

According to our documentation, the completed sprints should not be removed from the issues' Sprint field value.

h3. Actual Results

All sprints (including completed sprints) are overwritten.

h3. Workaround

In order to bulk-add a new sprint to issues without losing the association to the completed ones, you can use CSV import:
* Add a column called *Sprint* to each sprint value you want to keep in the issue
** Map that column to the field *Sprint* during the import.
fields.summary: Bulk-edit operation overwrites the field Sprint

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 26th March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ffab00|titleBGColor=#ffab00|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for your feedback on this problem. We appreciate the time that you took to help us be better.

Though not ideal, this behaviour in-product today is not a bug. Proposed behaviour of Screens here are a feature request and have to be prioritised against other requests.

The layout and fields that appear on screens must be defined in the Screen configuration. This also includes any required fields, to learn more about defining your screen (See [Defining a Screen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+a+Screen]).

We're using bugs to track any issues that prevent our features from being used as intended.

But we also understand and appreciate the expectations you have of our product so we have converted this to a feature suggestion instead.

Please watch this Jira issue for future updates as we continue to work on improving our product.

Regards,
 Andrew Trieu
 Atlassian
{panel}
h4. Problem Definition

As a user, I modify my field configuration and turn a 'field' into a Required Field. I expect this required field to be visible on my Issue Create and View screens as I will not be able to proceed with issue creation without populating this field.

Currently required fields need to be defined in the Screen view otherwise they will not be visible. This means I will not be able to proceed with Issue Create unless I define that field in the Screen View.


h4. Suggested Solution

Automatically may required fields visible in the Issue Create screen.


----
-Steps to reproduce-
 # -Modify field configuration and make Affects Version a required field-
 # -Create new Scrum Sample board-
 # -Click on + to create a new epic-

h4. -Excepted Result-

-Required fields show up-
h4. -Actual Result-

-Affects Version is missing-

-(!) This does not only apply to the Affects Version field, but any required field.-
h4. -Workaround-
 - -Add field to appropriate screen (See [Defining a Screen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+a+Screen])-
fields.summary: Required fields does not show up when creating a new epic from plan view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Ability to Display time in "Jira Issues Calendar" gadget. The time should also be taken into account in order to record issues that only occur at certain times and to have an overview of upcoming changes. The start and end time of the change should be displayed in the calendar.

*Suggested Solution*

Make it possible to configure the gadget in a way that it displays the time of issues recorded.
fields.summary: Display Time in the Jira Issue Calendar gadget

fields.description:
Branch for each field value.
Example use-cases.
 * For each version - send a webhook

 * For each component - create a sub task

 * For each user in custom field - send an sms

 * For each checkbox selected - create an issue

 * For number field create a sub-task for each

 * For each comment, perform an action.

 * For each request participant, add as customer
fields.summary: Ability to iterate / loop over each value in multivalue field or issue field changes

fields.description:
I'm working on issues in a particular epic assigned to me, so I've set my filters for that. Anytime I return to the Jira board, these filters disappear. Not only is it a waste of time to reset them, but if I haven't set those filters when I add a new issue it won't set the epic as the issue parent. If the epic remained set as my default filter on that board, then I wouldn't end up creating issues without a parent. 

The simple fix: retain the user's last filter settings until they're explicitly cleared.
fields.summary: Save user's filter settings for a Jira board until cleared

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there is a custom priority icon and we add a filter subscription for a filter that includes the priority field, the notification sent is not loading the custom priority icon.

 !Screen Shot 2021-03-19 at 17.50.58.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Customize a Priority Icon
 # Creates a filter that includes the Priority field
 # Send the email

h3. Expected Results
The custom priority icon should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The custom priority icon breaks.

h3. Workaround
- Upload the priority Icon to a public image repository.
- Upload the icon as an "Issue type" icon, and use the URL as _*/secure/viewavatar?size=medium&avatarId=<avatar_id>&avatarType=issuetype*_. You can get the avatar id by right-clicking on the icon > copy URL after you've uploaded it.
fields.summary: Custom priority icon is not displayed on notification from filter subscription

fields.description:
I attempted to search for any existing issues with summaries including "dashboard" and one of the following: "note" or "text", and couldn't find anything.

I would like to see a built-in gadget for adding static user-editable text to act as a sticky note within the dashboard for information that needs to be referenced frequently.
fields.summary: Dashboards Built-in Sticky Notes Text Gadget

fields.description:
Please change "atlassian" in JIRA's URL to e.g. "atlas-sian".

I'm afraid that all we see currently is "blah-ass-blah".
fields.summary: Change the string "atlassian" to not include the word "ass"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When changing issue type from Epic to Initiative, it would be great to have the possibility to also convert the previous child Stories/Tasks into Epics and make them child of the Initiative.
h3. Actual Results

When you update the issue type from Epic to Initiative, the child issues from the Epics are not kept since it's not possible to make a relationship between Story/Tasks and Initiative
h3. Expected Results

It would be great if when changing issue type from Epic to Initiative, Jira offers you the possibility to also convert the current child Story/Tasks into Epics and then link them to the just converted Initiative.
fields.summary: When changing issue type from Epic to Initiative, it would be great to have the possibility to also convert Stories/Tasks into Epics

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When using the [Microsoft Teams for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217836/microsoft-teams-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] it is not possible to upload a file to the tickets

h3. Suggested Solution
Add means to attach files via this integration

h3. Why this is important
Would be helpful means of extending this integration, and provide more function to end users.
fields.summary: Microsoft Teams for Jira Cloud should support file uploads to the issue attachments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Microsoft Teams integration app currently only supports en-US language locale.  This poses a problem for users of other languages.


h3. Suggested Solution
Add support for other languages that Atlassian Cloud already supports such as those in [Manage your language preferences|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-your-language-preferences/].

h3. Why this is important
Important for the sake of accessibility throughout language selection options.
fields.summary: Microsoft Teams integration for Jira Cloud should support user selected language

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

I would like to sort the issue by most recently viewed issue in the Link Issue field dropdown. Currently, the issues do populate by most recently viewed but in reverse order.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a feature to sort the issues in ascending order. For example, inside the issues from the project *MMP* we can see the issues pop up from the project *TDT* even though the most recently viewed issue was *MMP-17* which is at the bottom of the search

 !image-2021-03-19-18-35-05-282.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to sort the issues in the Link Issue field dropdown

fields.description:
With the JQL feature "issueLinkType" it is possible to bring all the issues that have issues linked with the indicated issue link type, and in the search results the column "Links" shows all the issues linked. It would be good to be able to filter the issues in the Link column to only show the issues that match the issueLinkType we filtered. At this moment the Links column has no logic implemented in it and it will always show all the issues linked, regardless of its link type, this can be confusing as the search does not offer a way to know what link type each linked issue has.

This suggestion would also allow greater flexibility and help customers who use issue linking as a means of establishing dependency. For example with this feature implemented it would be possible to retrieve all the issues that are "Blocked by" another issue and then see which issues are they in the "Link" column.

For implementation this could be done using an "all" or "match" flag, or in the form of a checkbox indicated in the "Link" column header itself.
fields.summary: Implement being able to filter out non matching issue types when using issueLinkType in JQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing the All Issues filter in a project the page doesn't load. This screen will use the JQL _project = XX ORDER BY created DESC_ and will fail if it returns too many results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
 # Have a project with a lot of issues (~500k);
 # Access the All Issues filter on *Issues* > *All Issues*.

h3. Expected Results

The page will load and limit the results like when using the Advanced Search.

h3. Actual Results

The page only loads the headers and not the filter results:
!Image 2021-03-19 at 9.32.31 AM.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

To access the issues from the project, use the Advanced Search on *Filters* > *Advanced Search for Issues* using the JQL _project = XX ORDER BY created DESC_.
fields.summary: When accessing the All Issues filter in a project the page doesn't load

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The insert file for attachment is not available on a reduced screen mode when creating an issue and uploading an attachment

h3. Environment
Jira Software

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create an issue
Exit the full screen in your laptop to reduce the screen size.
Upload an attachment > select the file from your laptop, you will not find an insert file link to insert the attachment to the ticket.
Maximize the screen, the option to insert the file is available


h3. Expected Results
 When the screen is reduced, the attachment screen should also reduce automatically to show the insert file option for attachment

h3. Actual Results
No option available to insert the attachment file when screen is reduced.

h3. Workaround
Work on Full screen mode

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Insert file link for attachment not available when screen is reduced/not on full screen

fields.description:
Currently, there are no dashboard gadgets that can be used to calculate story point estimates.

Please include an out-of-box dashboard gadget to calculate Story point estimation.
fields.summary: Dashboard gadget for Story Points.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When hovering over the comment emoji button, it starts flickering when near the edge of the icon. It occurs only in a next-gen template. I've recorded a video for better understanding:

 

[^Emoji flickering bug.mp4]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an issue at your next-gen project
 # Scroll until reaching the comments
 # Hover over the edge of the emoji icon until starts flickering.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to click on the emoji button and react to it.
h3. Actual Results

The emoji button starts flickering until you reach the center of the button, where you can select one of the emojis.
h3. Workaround

Reach the center of the button should allow you to select one of the emojis as should by default.
fields.summary: Emoji button on a comment flickers while hovering over. Next-gen project only.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Workload Pie Chart report breaking to calculate percentage when the item has more than 5965 hours, it displays a negative number.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and set its original estimate to *5966h or more*
 # Generate a *Workload Pie Chart report* based on *Current estimate*

h3. Expected Results
It should display the assignee value and calculate % to be 100%.

h3. Actual Results
It displays a negative percentage, -99%.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Other notes
Other *Statistic types* are also affected.
fields.summary: Workload Pie Chart report showing negative percentages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the list view in the issue navigator, it is not possible to select two custom fields with the same name and type as columns. Only one of the fields will be displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two custom fields with the exact same name and type.  
 # Go to the issue navigator page > Click in the left button to select the "List view"
 # try to add the fields as columns

h3. Expected Results

the fields should be displayed as options
h3. Actual Results

Just one of the fields are displayed to be selected:
!Screen Shot 2021-03-18 at 16.35.33.png|width=518,height=166!

!Screen Shot 2021-03-18 at 16.35.48.png|width=525,height=121!
h3. Workaround

Change the name of one of the fields.
fields.summary: Custom fields with the same name and same type can not be displayed as columns on the List view of the issue navigator

fields.description: Currently , a sub-task's 'Sprint' field cannot be edited as it is inherited from the Parent task. In old issue view, a message is displayed that the Sprint field is '*Inherited from Parent*'. Please consider adding a similar message in Issue view screen, for sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Add a message for 'Sprint' field, for sub-tasks, that it is inherited from Parent.
Automation for Jira: Provide a list of allowed ports in the "Send web request" action component for external Webhook URLs

fields.description:
Hi,

In the old issue view, the activity tab that you opened the last became the default open tab.

In the new issue view, "Comments" are always the default open tab.

Depending on customers use-cases, They do not necessarily want to open "Comments" by default. We need a way to set which activity tab to open by default, or have the same mechanism of the old issue view. 

Best regards,
fields.summary: New issue view : Set defaut activity tab to open by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a *_custom type sub-task_* from the parent issue, the create issue screen takes the default *sub-task* issue type instead of the custom sub-task.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Include a custom sub-task to a project issue type scheme.
 # Create a Sub-task from a parent issue using the "*+*" option (screen 1).
 
h3. Expected Results
The custom type sub-task issue should be created.


h3. Actual Results

Default sub-task issue is created (screen2).

h3. Workaround
Please be mindful in selecting the custom type sub-task from the create issue screen.
fields.summary: Custom type sub-task issue creation.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the publishing of an automation rule fails due to permissions, it will throw which permission is missing as in the message below (where the action refers to adding comments): *Either you or the rule actor for this rule is missing some required permissions: ADD_COMMENTS*

But that will not say which project is responsible, for global project rules this may be cumbersome to troubleshoot. 

And there is a specific scenario that can be even more troubling, projects that are archived will still be tied to active permission schemes, but archived projects will also throw the permission errors to publish the rule.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a global automation rule to edit a field and include 2 active projects in it
 # Archive one of the projects
 # Edit anything on the rule, such as the description and try to publish

h3. Suggestion
Specify which project is responsible for the failure to publish the automation rule and consider pointing out archived projects
fields.summary: Improve error messages for permission errors to publish automation rules

fields.description:
We have recently run into an issue where we had to remove site admin permissions from multiple users but found that in doing so we removed their ability to create issue types and manage workflows for their own projects. 

 

We would like to see the ability added so that project leads and admins can administer their own projects without necessarily being able to add and remove users, or making changes that could impact the rest of the organization.
fields.summary: Allow Project Leads to Edit Workflows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Comment trigger fails to execute while using "User condition" when rule actor is set to "User who triggered the event"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an automation rule on which the trigger is "Comment Added"
# Add a "User Condition" like:
## *User*: "User who triggered the event"
## *Check to perform*: "Is not a customer"
# *Action*: Log Action
# Add a comment as a customer in the portal
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Able to see the entry on the logs.

h3. Actual Results
Automation fails to execute with Status = Some Errors.
{noformat}
Issue event trigger could not retrieve this issue for further processing
{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround
Set the rule to run on the Automation's behalf.
fields.summary: Comment trigger fails to execute while using "User condition" when rule actor is set to "User who triggered the event"

fields.description: Copy/Paste from text editor does not respect the last action keyboard "Space" or "Enter"
fields.summary: Copy/Paste from text editor does not respect the last action keyboard "Space" or "Enter"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding a quick link gadget to the dashboard, selecting *Watches* or *Votes*, it's redirecting us to the last filter viewed and not the issues that we're a watcher or voted.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard
 # Add the gadget *Quick Links*
 # Click on *Watches*, *My unresolved reported issues* or *Votes*

(i) Reproducing the problem: 
 [^quickLing_gadget_bug.mp4]
h3. Expected Results

We should be redirected to the advanced issue search showing all issues that we're watching, voted on, or unresolved reported by the user.
h3. Actual Results

We're redirected to the advanced issue search for the last filter viewed by us.
h3. Workaround

Using a *Filter Results* gadget with a saved filter.

Filter JQL: resolution = Unresolved and reporter = currentUser()
fields.summary: Quick Link gadget is not working correctly

fields.description:
Apps need to get the billing plan in order to manage the permission in a different way for each plan because of the limitations of free plans. Currently, the permissions for users in a free plan cannot change. The same Apps (Connect, Forge, or REST API) can be used with different billing plans. Furthermore, the same Jira instance may be on different plans for each Jira product (JSW vs JSM). Therefore, Apps will need to know the billing plan that applies at the project level, where the intersection of billing plan and product matter most.

Example case:
 * Have 2 Jira products with different plans
 * Create a project
 * Try to see if the project belongs to a free plan product. To do that, as it is explained here ([https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/update-on-atlassians-free-cloud-plans/36604]), an App can only get the Audit Reports to see if the product is a free plan product. This is not sufficient because the Audit Report is not specific to the project.

(Additional note: the fields on JAC issues do not allow me to indicate this is related to the recent tiering of Jira into different plans. There is no "plan" or "edition" component.)
fields.summary: Billing plans: Apps need to know the licensing tier by project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users with only Browse project permission (read-only) cannot see fields that are empty in the new issue view. In the Issue Layout, the fields are not configured to be hidden when empty.
Users with read-only access are unaware that the issue may contain other fields in the issue which are left empty.
Users would need Edit Issues permissions to see the field that are empty. But the admin may not want the users to edit the issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Provide only Browse Project permission to a user/group
 # Field with 'Empty' values are not visible to the user. In the Issue Layout, the fields are not configured to be hidden when empty.

h3. Expected Results
The Empty fields should be shown to users with read-only access. 

h3. Actual Results
The Empty fields are not shown to users with read-only access.

h3. Workaround
Provide Edit issues permission to the users.
fields.summary: Users with only Browse project permission (read-only) cannot see fields that are empty in the new issue view

fields.description:
Provide an Option or a Choice for the Org Admins at the Org Level to turn OFF email notifications from being sent out to Managed Users when an Org Admin
 * Removes product/Atlassian access.
 * When the Managed User(s) is deactivated or Deleted.
fields.summary: Turn Off email notification when revoking access for managed users.

fields.description:
Currently, there is a limitation of adding only 100 IP addresses or network blocks per product instance.

It would be helpful for enterprise businesses to have more than 100 IP addresses or network blocks per product instance.
fields.summary: Increase the IP addresses in the allowed list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When moving between linked issues from different projects, the system does not reflect the correct Tabs for that project. It retains the Tabs from the previous one until you refresh the screen again. This is intermittent.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# project 1 - issue screen contains 2 Tabs
# create issue1 on project 1
# project 2 - issue screen contains 3 Tabs
# create issue2 on project 2
# link project 1 issue 1 to project 2 issue 2 
# open issue 1, then from the same screen click on the linked issue 2

h3. Expected Results
each issue will show its own Tabs (issue 1 will show 2 Tabs, issue 2 will show 3 Tabs)
h3. Actual Results
issue 1 - shows 2 Tabs, issue 2 - shows 2 Tabs. Upon refreshing, issue 2 will show 3 Tabs
h3. Workaround
Refresh page
fields.summary: Tabs in screen won't refresh upon project change on linked issues

fields.description:
Dear Jira team,

Our company relies on Jira heavily to manage our product and infrastructure eng sprints.  One thing I sorely miss from Asana are the fun animations when a task is completed. I've heard of others making java script add-ons to do this, but feel Jira would be more fun and engaging if there was a "reward" for completing tasks.  A lovely dopamine hit, if you will. 

Thanks for considering this!

Julie
fields.summary: Fun animations when completing stories or tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Trying to create a group using a bookmark or direct link causes the page to get unresponsive:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure you have the *Browse user and group global permission* 
 # To have a big number of users (>100)
 # Go to the people section to create a Team, it works (/)
 # Go to the people section using this direct link [https://site-url.atlassian.net/jira/people/search#createTeam]
 # The page hangs and finally crashes (x)

h3. Expected Results

The direct link should work.
h3. Actual Results

The page gets blocked.
h3. Workaround

Go to the People page and click on creating a team.
fields.summary: Trying to create a group using a bookmark or direct link causes the page to get unresponsive

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When there is at least one version displayed on the calendar, if we try to export in ical format, the file downloaded has zero bytes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a gadget *Issue Calendar*
 # Under *Project or a Saved filter* select a project
 # On *Date to display* select _Due date_
 # Create a version with a Release Date on the project added to the gadget
 # Refresh the gadget until the version appears there.
 # Click on *Export in iCal format*

h3. Expected Results
The file is downloaded correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The file download does not contain any size (0 bytes).

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue calendar gadget is exporting empty ical file

fields.description:
As an Admin, I would like to be able to disable/hide the New Issue View top buttons (create subtask, attachment, link issues):

 !image-2021-03-16-18-05-55-521.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to disable/hide New Issue View top buttons (create subtask, attachment, link issues)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Auto approve/decline action does not work with actor “User who triggered the event”

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Having a workflow with an approval process set up, create a ticket, and have it in the waiting approval status.
# Create an automation using the *Approve/Decline request* action.
# Set the Actor of the automation to *User who triggered the event*.
# Trigger the automation to approve/disapprove the transition with a user with the *approver role*.

h3. Expected Results
The ticket will transition to the corresponding status, depending on the approval or disapproval.

h3. Actual Results
Automation will fail and log the following error:
{noformat}
There was a problem with attempting auto approve/decline in Jira. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian support
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
* Change the actor to *Automation for Jira*.
fields.summary: Auto approve/decline action does not work with actor “User who triggered the event”

fields.description:
Users would benefit from having a way to customize the way fields are grouped in the issue layout by adding custom 'field separators'.

This would be different than screen tabs or context vs description fields as all the fields would still be visible at the same time in the right panel but could be grouped for better management.
fields.summary: Ability to add customizable field separators in the issue layout

fields.description:
Hi 

I need for you to please fix the fact that when I want to send a note or feature update etc... to our Jira software users or confluence users *notification is also sent to revoked users* *(unlicensed)* This totally does not make sense why would I advise them of a new feature or changes to Jira if they have been revoked from using our Jira instance?

Also please fix the administration it is not user-friendly at all.  

When I go to administration I want to be able to click on *details* and add users to the Jira project and confluence space why go to two different areas.  Show me Jira project with connected confluence space to action both at the same time. 

Remove the revoked non-active users from the main list and only show them when I select non-active users.   

Also in confluence put the permissions page on the first page for admins to view only why have to go through so much red tape to get there. 

Change the permissions page in Confluence to a more friendly and easy way to add users this is really tedious the click on add and save all.  

Administration of users needs a new look and feel.  A more user-friendly vibe. 

Thanks

Denise
fields.summary: Unlicensed users getting notifications

fields.description: able to delete filters in a bulk, when you have a short number of filters it's ok to deleted one-by-one but when you have over 1000 filters a bulk delete would be nice to have
fields.summary: Bulk delete filters in jira cloud as a feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL currently can display the linked issues attached however, when required to have the details of the linked issues in the same we would not be able to retrieve. Would be good to have this feature to retrieve the details of the issues linked issue as well. 
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JQL to have functionality to retrieve the linked issue details as well

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have a status that contains all uppercases when you save a filter that contains this status the dropdown in the basic search will show duplicated versions of this status and return an error besides the status name.

The results of the filter are unaltered. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit your status name to all uppercase, for example, IN PROGRESS;
 # Create a filter containing this status;
 # Save the filter.

h3. Expected Results
The filter behaves normally.

h3. Actual Results
The status appears duplicated in the dropdown of the basic search and display the error:
"Status is not valid for your current project and/or issue type selection"

h3. Workaround
* This happens only on the basic search, switching to the advanced behaves normally;
* Editing the status name so that doesn't contain all uppercases fixes the issue;
* Using the status ID instead of its name works as expected as well.
fields.summary: Statuses that are all uppercase will appear duplicate and show an error in saved filters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Unable to Add System fields to Create Link issue screen

The Epic fields are locked by default. Fields such as "Epic Name", "Epic Link", "Epic Status". It is not possible to make the field Mandatory in the field configuration.

Since the Create Link issue screen is not editable, unable to add the system field without making the field as Mandatory.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow systems fields to be added to create a linked issue screen without setting the field as Mandatory.
fields.summary: Ability to add system fields to Create Link Issue screen.

fields.description: as the title shows, anyone knows how to solve it? Thanks
fields.summary: How to hide "Updated" field ? How to show "Creator" ?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

500 error responses are intermittently returned to requests to delete issue using the Jira REST API.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invoke the Jira REST API to delete an issue.

h3. Expected Results

500 HTTTP error response is never returned.
h3. Actual Results

500 HTTTP error responses are intermittently observed. One occurrence was at 2021-03-11 09:10:30,019. Further details that should not be shared publicly will be provided separately.
h3. Workaround

Attempt a retry, the issue is transient and will generally work on a subsequent attempt.
fields.summary: REST API calls to delete issues intermittently results in 500 responses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is no way for apps to subscribe to epic change events in team-managed (formerly next-gen) projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an app that registers webhooks of all types.
 # Change the epic of any team-managed (formerly next-gen) issue

h3. Expected Results

A webhook is fired.
h3. Actual Results

No webhooks are fired.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Updating the epic of a team-managed (formerly next-gen) issue does not fire any webhooks

fields.description:
Currently, you can only pin fields through the issue view and it only applies to the current project.

In scenarios in which you have multiple projects, having an option to pin fields in a scheme would be very helpful in managing it and ensuring all projects follow the desired pattern.
fields.summary: Ability to pin fields through screen scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Project boards do not load and throw 500 error if there is a custom field configured on the Jira instance that has a blank field for a name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with any name
 # Edit custom field, and edit the name of the custom field to only have a blank "space" character and save changes
 # Try to load a project board - the board will not load and throw a 500 error

h3. Expected Results

Jira should prevent users from editing an existing custom field's name to " " (a blank space character) - this breaks the boards and results in a 500 error
h3. Actual Results

It is possible to edit a custom field's name, and change it to " " (a blank space)

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$BlankStringArgumentException: names[0] should not be empty!
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions.containsNoBlanks(Assertions.java:161)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseNames.<init>(ClauseNames.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.DefaultClauseNamesService.lambda$forCustomField$2(DefaultClauseNamesService.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.workcontext.metrics.Timer.time(Timer.java:208)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.DefaultClauseNamesService.forCustomField(DefaultClauseNamesService.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.getClauseNames(ImmutableCustomField.java:565)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Rename the affected custom field so that it has a name and save the changes. This should allow the boards to load as expected.
fields.summary: Renaming Custom field as just a "blank space" character causes Project board not to load (500 error)
Support posting an entire Markdown document for Issue descriptions and comments in the API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding an additional _Permission Validator_ *Validator* to the Create transition in addition to the default *Create Issues* permission, the quick create for Sub-Tasks does not work and the full Create Issue screen is prompted instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Workflow associated with the Sub-Task issue type and add a *Validator* on the Create transition.
# Select the _Permission Validator_ and use a permission such as *Add Comments*
 !Transition__Create_-_GDS_Jira.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a Sub-Task using the quick create under a Task or Story

h3. Expected Results

The permission validator should happen in the background and if it passes, the Sub-Task would be created in the inline issues.

h3. Actual Results

The full Create Issue screen is triggered for no reason
 !2021-03-15_17-00-37.gif|width=400&height=200!

The bug is also applicable if you have multiple Workflows associated with different Sub-Tasks issue types, you will still be prompted and the quick create won't work if one of them has this validator. The same applies if a Standard issue type is sharing the Workflow of a Sub-task issue type.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. You should remove the *Validator* from the Create transition.
fields.summary: Quick create Sub-Task prompts Create Issue screen with validator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When clicked on the Epic from an initiative and moving back to Initiative would not display the content of the initiative, however the URL is already changed to the initiative issue type issuekey.

This can replicated only with Initiative issue type as Parent and Epic as Child Issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with type initiative in the roadmap plan -> add epic under the initiative. 
 # Review changes in the plan and it will be reflected in the board. 
 # Click on the initiative -> click on the child issue (Epic) anywhere in the issue and not the issue key.
 # You will see that you are in Epic, however when you click on the issue key of the initiative from the Epic, you will see the issue key changed in the address bar and the issue would not be displayed and stays in the Epic screen.

h3. Expected Results

Move back to initiative when clicked on the issue key
h3. Actual Results

!issue_key_navigation.gif|width=378,height=272!
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page
fields.summary: Moving back from Epic to Initiative does not work

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using smart values to access listed values, it's not possible to modify the output based on certain criteria or conditions.

For example, let's say you have a custom field of the type Select List (multiple choice), and the list contains items selected which we want to exclude or output in a different way. The custom field contains:
 * A
 * B
 * C
 * D

A use case would be to exclude some of those options if they are confidential, so the output looks like this (C is excluded):
 * A
 * B
 * D

Or it could be necessary to make certain substitutions:
 * A
 * B
 * Y
 * Z

Or change the formatting (in this case B is very important):
 * A
 * *B*
 * C
 * D

h3. Suggested Solution

Add additional smart value functions to the listed values. An example could be to add .equals to check the listed value against a set value to add additional formatting, and/or to add if/else logic to the listed smart values.

{{{{#issue.customfield_12345}}}}
* {{{{value}}}} {{{{#if(value.equals("Example value"))}}}} additional formatting {{{{/}}}} {{{{#else}}}} * Another value or different formatting {{{{/}}}}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Add more options to format listed values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing Issue Type is redirecting to Move Issue screen even when all Issue Types are having the same workflows and Field configuration.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

We are not able to replicate this behavior in all instances.
 # Open a project that has issue types associated with the same workflow, field configuration, and Screen.
 # Change the Issue type by click on the Issue Type Icon beside the Issue Key.
 # When selecting another Issue type it redirects to the Move issue screen.

h3. Expected Results

If the Issue Type has the same Workflow and field configuration, it has to change the Issue type directly without redirecting to the Move issue screen.
h3. Actual Results

In spite of having the same workflow are field configurations, it still redirects to the Move issue screen.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing Issue Type is redirecting to Move Issue screen.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
View Project Roles for User page CSS breaks as it seems like the respective text from the icons of the table are hidden in the left side of the screen. This makes the text to be on top of the project names and icons.
 !image-2021-03-12-18-07-11-839.png|thumbnail! 

If enough project roles are created and displayed in the screen, this text comes over to the top of important data.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create enough project roles to make hidden text appear on top of page core data
# Add the user to test this to all of those projects in the respective People section of these
# Go to User Management
# Chose a user from the list and click on ... then Show details
# Click on ... then View Jira project roles

h3. Expected Results
Page should be displayed as usual

h3. Actual Results
Page CSS breaks as it seems like the respective text from the icons of the table are hidden in the left side of the screen. This makes the text to be on top of the project names and icons.
 !image-2021-03-12-18-07-11-839.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Partial Workaround as it has to be done each time the page is accessed by the user:
# Open the development tools on the page with the presented behavior
# Head to the Console tab
# Run the command below:
{code}
elements = document.querySelectorAll('.icon-role-not-member,.icon-role-member'); len = elements.length; for (i = 0; i < len; i++){ elements[i].innerText = '' }
{code}
fields.summary: Having too many project roles may break CSS of View Project Roles for User page

fields.description:
Currently, there is only a "Create Issue" at the botton of the backlog. If the backlog has a long list of issues and you're at the top of it, you have to scroll to the botton to be able to start creating a new issue.

A new link at the top of that list will be very handy in order to quickly create a new issue
fields.summary: Add a "Create Issue" button at the top of the Backlog

fields.description:
In Nextgen projects with Open access, currently users are allowed to restrict issues to the roles that they are not associated with.
h3. Steps to Reproduce the issue:
 # Create a Nextgen project with Open access
 # User that creates the project will have Administrator access, do not grant member/viewer access
 -- Login as a user with Administrator access, create an issue and restrict the issue to Member or Viewer role. User will be allowed to restrict the issue to a role that they are not a part of. 
 -- Login as a user that is not associated with any role, create an issue and restrict access to Administrator/Member/Viewer. User will be allowed to set issue security to the access level that they do not belong to.

The feature to *Restrict Issue* is such that you can restrict it to any available role. However, to make sure that the users doesn’t lock themselves from the issue, we can see the *YOU* on the right for the roles that the current user is part of. 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

If the user is not a part of that Role, below warning will be displayed in order to alert the user:

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion:

Restricting the issue to a role that user doesn't belong to will lock themselves from the issue. In a scenario where the Project Lead (Administrator) is also not associated with Member or Viewer might end up losing access to the issues without any clue.

I would be nice if the users are not allowed to restrict issue to the roles they do not belong to.
fields.summary: In next-gen projects, allow users to restrict issues only to the roles they are associated

fields.description:
When having multiple attachments on an issue, you can click on them and get a preview for image/video types and navigate through the list of attachments to the left or right. In the new issue view it is only possible to navigate a few attachments to the left, and a few to the right, this happens in different combinations of attachments available to the left and right, but it is never more than 6.

The suggestion is to allow navigating through the entire attachment list, like in the old issue view.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Preview for attachment only allows navigating through 6 attachments at the time

fields.description:
When using ` to create code blocks in the new editor, the block erases the first letter.

Steps to Reproduce
Add a description using the new editor;
Type ` <put some information here> ` and press enter.
Expected Results
All the text will be surrounded by the code block.

Actual Results
The first letter will be erased, one quote will be placed outside the code block while the last one will be included in the code block.
fields.summary: Using ` to create code blocks is erasing the first letter in Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Enable “code” under Next-Gen features won’t be possible for site-admin on Limited and Private access levels.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the Next-Gen project by Private access to Limited: [evidence.|https://share.getcloudapp.com/5zuAEP5x]
 # Try to enable the code as I've made here into [this video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/kpu72W5w].

h3. Expected Results
A site-admin should be able to enable this feature without an Administrator role under Access.

h3. Actual Results
A site-admin won't be able to enable the code feature without an Administrator role under Access.

h3. Workaround
Grant Administrator role permission under the Access.
fields.summary: Enable “code” under Next-Gen features won’t be possible for site-admin on Limited and Private access levels

fields.description: As a user, I'd like to hide fields for some users/groups. This can be helpful for some scenarios, for example, if we need to store a value to report, we can use this field to store this data.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to hide fields for some users/group

fields.description:
The native desktop app in macOS does not have a link formatting option in its formatting toolbar. Links can be pasted raw, but cannot be edited to allow custom text.

Adding a link tool (and possibly adding a keyboard shortcut for Cmd+K) would allow people to hyperlink text in issue descriptions and comments.
fields.summary: Add link formatting in editor on macOS

fields.description: Right now, it's possible to reorder the comments on an issue by 'Newest first' - it would also be helpful to have the option to bring the comment box to the top of the comments. As it is now, users still have to scroll to the bottom of the page to post a new comment.
fields.summary: Ability to bring comment box to the top of an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new issue view, selecting a specific Activity tab for your Jira issue and then refreshing the page, does not persist your selection. 

It defaults to Comments tab on page reloads.

In the old issue view, your selection used to persist across all the issues, despite a page refresh.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the new issue view, scroll down to Activity and then click on History( or Worklog, say) to make that as the main tab – instead of Comments.
 # Refresh the page, and the Activity tab resets to Comments.
 # Open a new issue, and there too the Activity tab focuses on Comments and not History.

h3. Expected Results

In the old issue view, the Activity selection used to persist across page reloads and across different issues.
 !image-2021-03-11-18-56-42-635.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

In the new issue view, the Activity tab selection does not persist.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Activity tab selection does not persist in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user with German language preference creates a work log entry and adds for example "2.5h" Jira creates a work log entry of "3d 1h".

In German language, the decimal separator is a comma. But when we try "2,5h" the input field shows an error.

 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the profile settings page, set the language preference to Deutsch
 # Log time in decimal value like 2.5h

h3. Expected Results

Time entered in decimal value 2.5h has to be recorded correctly as 2h 30m.
h3. Actual Results

Decimal value is ignored and 2.5h is considered as 25 hours. 2.5h is logged as 3d 1h (8 hours per day).
h3. Workaround

Enter the time as 2h 30m instead of 2.5h
fields.summary: Work log fields do not accept decimal values when language preference is set to non-english languages that uses comma separated decimal values
